Class PieChartOptions

  • java.lang.Object

      • com.googlecode.gwt.charts.client.options.Options

  • public class PieChartOptions
extends Options
    Configuration options for PieChart.

      • setEnableInteractivity

        public final void setEnableInteractivity(boolean enableInteractivity)
        Whether the chart throws user-based events or reacts to user interaction. If false, the chart will not throw 'select' or other interaction-based events (but will throw ready or error events), and will not display hovertext or otherwise change depending on user input.
        Parameters:
        enableInteractivity -

      • setFontName

        public final void setFontName(String fontName)
        The default font face for all text in the chart. You can override this using properties for specific chart elements.
        Parameters:
        fontName -

      • setFontSize

        public final void setFontSize(double fontSize)
        The default font size, in pixels, of all text in the chart. You can override this using properties for specific chart elements.
        Parameters:
        fontSize -

      • setForceIFrame

        public final void setForceIFrame(boolean forceIFrame)
        Draws the chart inside an inline frame. (Note that on IE8, this option is ignored; all IE8 charts are drawn in i-frames.)
        Parameters:
        forceIFrame - true for drawing inside an inline frame

      • setIs3D

        public final void setIs3D(boolean is3D)
        If true, displays a three-dimensional chart.
        Parameters:
        is3D -

      • setLegend

        Configure various aspects of the legend.
        Parameters:
        legend -

      • setPieHole

        public final void setPieHole(double pieHole)
        If between 0 and 1, displays a donut chart. The hole with have a radius equal to number times the radius of the chart.
        Parameters:
        pieHole -

      • setPieStartAngle

        public final void setPieStartAngle(int pieStartAngle)
        The angle, in degrees, to rotate the chart by. The default of 0 will orient the leftmost edge of the first slice directly up.
        Parameters:
        pieStartAngle -

      • setReverseCategories

        public final void setReverseCategories(boolean reverseCategories)
        If set to true, will draw series from right to left. The default is to draw left-to-right. This option is only supported for a discrete major axis.
        Parameters:
        reverseCategories -
        See Also:
        Discrete vs Continuous

      • setSlice

        public final void setSlice(int index,
            Slice slice)
        Changes the slice format for a given index.
        Parameters:
        index - slice index
        slice - the format of the corresponding slice

      • setSlices

        public final void setSlices(Slice... slices)
        An array of objects, each describing the format of the corresponding slice in the pie.
        If a slice or a value is not specified, the global value will be used.
        Parameters:
        slices -

      • setSliceVisibilityThreshold

        public final void setSliceVisibilityThreshold(double sliceVisibilityThreshold)
        The slice relative part, below which a slice will not show individually. All slices that have not passed this threshold will be combined to a single slice, whose size is the sum of all their sizes. Default is not to show individually any slice which is smaller than half a degree.
        Parameters:
        sliceVisibilityThreshold - default is 1/720

      • setTitle
